w:r.w:t: Restaurant Owner, Product/BA, Designer, Developer, QA
v1.0 (2026-01-07): Initial PRD for Phase 1 MVP (Order & Pick-up)
authority to approve scope/budget OR operational influence that can block go-live.
frequency of interaction + impact of change on daily workflow.

digital solution for small/medium restaurants aiming to reduce dependency on third-party delivery platforms, improve operational efficiency, and enhance customer experience through clear ordering and real-time order status.
browse menu, add to cart, select pickup time, place order, track status.
manage menu, confirm/reject orders, update status, view basic performance.
Online payment, loyalty/membership, advanced analytics (out of scope for Phase 1).
Relies on third-party delivery platforms (e.g., GrabFood, ShopeeFood)
Processes orders via manual notes and fragmented channels
Does not own customer data (phone number, order history)
Encounters frequent order confusion and delays during peak hours
manual + disconnected workflow causes errors and slows service
no direct customer data to support retention
unclear order status → customers repeatedly ask staff → more chaos during peak
Reduce platform dependency by shifting order share to FOODORA
Reduce average order handling time during peak hours (baseline → target improvement)
Build a direct customer database and improve repeat purchases
3) Success Metrics, Acceptance Criteria, and Exit Criteria
≥ 30% of total orders placed via FOODORA within 8–12 weeks post-launch
wrong item / missing item / wrong quantity / incorrect pickup time recorded / status mismatch causing customer pickup failure.
Confirmed → Ready elapsed time (recommended operational metric).
Placed → Confirmed elapsed time (front-desk responsiveness metric).
user stories pass UAT (critical defects = 0 open)
Staff training completed; menu and pickup rules configured
receives order info; cares about clarity and accuracy
end users of mobile ordering and status tracking
Owner: weekly checkpoint + milestone demos; decision log and approvals
Cashier: workshops + weekly backlog review; usability + edge case validation; UAT walkthrough
Kitchen: short demos focused on workflow; peak-hour readiness
Customers: onboarding copy, QR instructions, status meaning clarity
Busy office worker, time-sensitive lunch ordering
Needs fast ordering, reliable pickup time, clear “Ready” signal
Needs minimal clicks, clear queue, quick status updates, low confusion
Staff can operate dashboard after training
Customers have smartphones and can receive on-screen status updates
Notification strategy (MVP: in-app refresh; push notifications optional later)
9.1 Flow A — Customer Places Pickup Order (Happy Path)
9.3 Flow C — Out of Stock / Reject
Restaurant rejects with reason before confirming
Customer sees status Cancelled + reason; encouraged to reorder
9.4 Flow D — Customer Cancels Before Confirmation
Status becomes Cancelled; dashboard reflects cancellation
: id, restaurantId, categoryId, name, description, price, imageUrl(optional), isAvailable, updatedAt
: id, restaurantId, customerId(optional), customerPhone, pickupTime, status, subtotal, total, notes(optional), createdAt, confirmedAt, readyAt, completedAt, cancelledAt, cancelReason(optional)
: id, orderId, menuItemId, nameSnapshot, priceSnapshot, qty
: id, orderId, fromStatus, toStatus, changedBy, changedAt
View item detail (name, price, availability; optional image/description).
Display results quickly and handle empty results state.
Display chosen pickup time consistently (checkout + confirmation + tracking).
Collect minimum: phone number; optional name/note.
Submit order and receive Order ID.
Show confirmation with next steps (“Pay at counter”, pickup instructions).
Show current status and timestamps (where available).
Show status descriptions (what each status means).
Customer can cancel only before confirmation (Placed).
If status is Confirmed or later, cancellation option is disabled with explanation.
Customer can view past orders (basic list).
Display key info: pickupTime, orderId, item count, customer phone, status.
Show items, quantities, notes, pickup time, timestamps.
Show actions allowed by current status.
Reject requires reason and transitions to Cancelled (with reason).
Record timestamp + operator for each transition.
Toggle availability quickly; changes reflected to customer app.
Daily summary: orders count, total revenue, average processing time.
View order history with status and timestamps.
Optional: max orders per slot (capacity cap).
cancelled by customer (before confirm) or rejected by restaurant (with reason)
Customer cancellation only when status = Placed
Restaurant cancellation allowed before Ready; must provide reason
Once Ready, cancellation is restricted (optional operational rule)
Slots generated based on interval and restaurant business hours
Slots cannot be in the past
Price snapshot is captured at time of order creation to avoid later menu price changes affecting old orders
Availability change during checkout → block submit; show which items are unavailable
Slot becomes unavailable during submit → prompt customer to choose another slot
Dashboard transition conflict (two operators) → lock or “last write wins” with warning (implementation choice)
As an Admin, I want to create a menu category so that customers can browse items logically.
Given I am logged in as Admin, when I create a category with a non-empty name, then the category is saved and appears in the category list.
Given a category name already exists (case-insensitive), when I try to create a duplicate, then the system prevents saving and shows an error message.
Given I enter a name longer than the allowed limit (e.g., 50 chars), then the system shows validation error and blocks saving.
As an Admin, I want to create a menu item so that customers can order it.
Given I am Admin, when I create an item with required fields (name, price, category), then the item appears in the menu list.
Given price ≤ 0, when I save, then the system blocks saving and shows validation error.
Given I leave name empty, when I save, then validation error is shown.
Given I set item availability to “Unavailable”, then the customer app displays it as out-of-stock and prevents ordering.
As a Cashier/Admin, I want to toggle item availability so that customers cannot order out-of-stock items during peak hours.
Given an item is Available, when I toggle it to Unavailable, then the change is saved and reflected on the customer app.
Given a customer has the item in cart, when the item becomes Unavailable before checkout submission, then checkout is blocked and the customer is informed which item is unavailable.
As an Admin, I want to edit an item’s price/description so that the menu stays accurate.
Given an item exists, when I update price and save, then the new price is shown to customers for future orders.
Given an order already exists, item price changes do not change historical order totals (price snapshot rule).
As a Customer, I want to browse items by category so I can find what I want quickly.
Given the menu exists, when I open the app, then categories are displayed and selectable.
When I select a category, then only items from that category are displayed.
Given a category has no items, then an empty state is shown (no crash).
As a Customer, I want to search items by keyword so I can find items faster.
Given I type a keyword, when I search, then matching items are displayed.
Given no items match, then a “No results” state is shown.
As a Customer, I want to add items to cart so I can build my order.
Given an item is Available, when I tap Add, then it is added to cart and cart total updates.
Given an item is Unavailable, when I tap Add, then the system blocks adding and shows “Out of stock”.
As a Customer, I want to change quantities so I can adjust my order.
When I increase/decrease quantity, then subtotal and total update immediately.
Given I reduce quantity to zero, then the item is removed from cart.
As a Customer, I want to select a pickup time slot so I know when to pick up my order.
Given available slots exist, when I open pickup selection, then I see a list of available slots (not in the past).
When I select a slot, then it is displayed in checkout summary.
Given a slot is full/unavailable, when I tap it, then I cannot select it and I see an explanation.
US-APP-06 (Must) Place Pickup Order (Pay at Counter)
As a Customer, I want to place my pickup order so the restaurant can prepare it.
Given cart is not empty AND pickup time is selected AND phone number is provided, when I confirm order, then an order is created with an Order ID and status = Placed.
Then I see an order confirmation screen showing: Order ID, pickup time, items, total, and “Pay at counter”.
Given any cart item becomes Unavailable at submission time, when I confirm, then the order is NOT created and the system shows which items must be removed/changed.
Given the selected pickup slot becomes unavailable at submission time, then submission is blocked and customer must re-select a slot.
As a Customer, I want to track order status so I know when to come pick it up.
Given I have an active order, when I open tracking, then I see current status and timestamps (if available).
Given restaurant updates status to Ready, when I refresh/open tracking, then status shows Ready.
Given order is Cancelled, then the tracking screen shows Cancelled with reason (if provided by restaurant).
As a Customer, I want to cancel my order before the restaurant confirms it.
Given status = Placed, when I tap Cancel and confirm, then order becomes Cancelled and disappears from active queue.
Given status ≠ Placed (Confirmed/Preparing/Ready/Completed), then Cancel action is not available and the app explains cancellation is no longer possible.
As a customer, I want to view item details so I can decide before adding to cart.
Item detail displays name, price, availability, and description/image (if provided).
As a customer, I want to view past orders so I can reference previous purchases.
History lists completed/cancelled orders with date, total, and status.
As a Cashier, I want to see new orders in a queue so I can process them quickly.
Given a customer placed an order, when I open the dashboard queue, then the order appears under Placed.
Each order row shows: Order ID, pickup time, item count, customer phone, created time.
New orders are visually distinct (e.g., highlight) until opened/confirmed (implementation detail acceptable).
As a Cashier, I want to confirm an order so the kitchen can start preparing.
Given status = Placed, when I click Confirm, then status becomes Confirmed and confirmed timestamp is recorded.
Given two staff attempt to confirm simultaneously, then only one confirmation succeeds and the other sees a “status already updated” message.
As a Cashier, I want to reject an order with a reason so the customer understands.
Given status = Placed, when I click Reject, then I must select/enter a reason.
When I submit rejection, then status becomes Cancelled, cancelled timestamp is recorded, and cancel reason is stored.
Customer sees Cancelled + reason in tracking.
As a Cashier, I want to update statuses so customers receive accurate pickup signals.
Given status = Confirmed, when I set Preparing, then status becomes Preparing and timestamp is recorded.
Given status = Preparing, when I set Ready, then status becomes Ready and ready timestamp is recorded.
Given status = Ready, when I set Completed, then status becomes Completed and completed timestamp is recorded.
Invalid transitions are blocked (e.g., Ready → Preparing).
US-DASH-05 (Must) Audit Trail for Status Changes
As an Owner/Admin, I want to know who changed an order status for accountability.
Each status change records: fromStatus, toStatus, changedBy, changedAt.
Audit log is viewable in order detail (minimal list).
As a staff member, I want to log in to the dashboard so that only authorized users can access orders and customer data.
Given valid credentials, when I log in, then I can access the dashboard.
Given invalid credentials, when I log in, then I see an error and cannot access the dashboard.
As an Owner/Admin, I want role-based access so that permissions are controlled.
Admin can access Menu + Orders + Reporting + Settings.
Cashier can access Orders; menu editing is limited to availability toggle (if configured).
As a cashier, I want to view full order details before confirming so I can avoid mistakes.
Order detail shows items, qty, notes, pickup time, customer phone, timestamps.
Actions shown depend on current status.
As an Admin, I want to configure pickup slot interval so that pickup time selection matches kitchen capacity.
Admin can set slot interval (e.g., 10 minutes).
Customer app shows slots generated accordingly.
As an Owner, I want to view daily performance so I can evaluate results.
Given a selected date, dashboard shows total orders, total revenue, orders by status.
Dashboard shows average processing time (Confirmed → Ready).
order queue refresh ≤ 10 seconds (MVP acceptable); target ≤ 5 seconds later
confirm an order in ≤ 2 clicks from queue
RBAC; protect customer phone number; no unauthenticated access
record status transitions with operator + timestamp
store minimum necessary customer data; restrict access to customer phone to authorized staff roles
Peak time distribution by pickup slot (optional)
Item becomes unavailable during checkout → block submit; show impacted items
Pickup slot becomes unavailable → require re-selection
Restaurant rejects due to out-of-stock → customer sees Cancelled + reason
Customer cancels before confirm → dashboard updates accordingly
Duplicate clicks on confirm/status update → system prevents double transitions
Network delay: customer sees stale status → refresh mechanism + last updated timestamp
Entry: test environment ready; menu configured; test users; UAT plan approved
Exit: all Must stories passed; critical defects resolved; owner sign-off obtained
Objective: build customer database → Epic 2 (phone + history)
Staff resistance → training + minimal UI clicks + pilot run
Low customer adoption → QR onboarding + counter signage + staff prompts
Peak-hour load → queue performance targets + simple status model + capacity slots (optional)
